channel.title: R on DATA 650 Blog - Ron Richardson
channel.description: Recent content in R on DATA 650 Blog - Ron Richardson

item.title: Building Histograms
item.description: Another great way to visualize data is by using a histogram. A histogram is very simple to do. library(Lahman) library(dplyr) ## ## Attaching package: 'dplyr' ## The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': ## ## filter, lag ## The following objects are masked from 'package:base': ## ## intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(ggplot2) df<-Master %>% filter(!is.na(weight)) %>% select(weight) ggplot()+ geom_histogram(data=df,aes(x=weight), color="white", fill="blue", bins=25) + ggtitle("Baseball player weights")

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
